Employment: Progress: SW met with mom and dad bedside to offer SW support. Mom reported she is currently out of work on FMLA due to giving birth. Dad asked questions regarding the difference in collecting unemployment and FMLA. Father explained further he is a truck driver and this is a slow time of year for the business. SW and father spoke about FMLA protecting his job, however he reported his job would be protected.
Financial: SW also spoke with parents about PA secondary MA

SW also spoke with parents about PA secondary MA. Mom and both reported bring stressed about the cost of the current hospital stay and also the medical costs moving forward. SW referred the family to FHCP for assistance. The SW LOMN was signed by Dr. Smith and she reported she would also work on the PA 586 form. FHCP reported they would reach out to the family once those forms were received. Father also reported issues in the parking garage the other day. He reported the machine was broke and they made him pay $64 dollars to get his car out. Both mother and father reported this was a stressor. SW problem solved with them, and SW assessed the need to replace $50 for them due to the financial hardship of a prolonged hospital stay. SW provided 2 $25 gift cards to bedside. SW also provided mom and dad with meal vouchers and parking passes for assistance moving forward
